meanings.definition: A high point of land or rock projecting into the sea or other water beyond the line of coast.
meanings.sent1: The promontory offered a stunning view of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: We hiked to the promontory to see the waves crashing below.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls gathered on the promontory, holding a meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a promontory in the sea of challenges she faced.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse stood tall on the promontory, guiding ships safely.

meanings.definition: A prominent mass of land overlooking or projecting into a lowland.
meanings.sent1: The castle was perched on the promontory, watching over the valley.
meanings.sent2: The promontory provided a strategic advantage for the army.
meanings.sent3: The promontory seemed to be the king of the lowlands, surveying its domain.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed off the promontory, reaching every corner of the valley.
meanings.sent5: The promontory stood like a guardian, protecting the fields below.
